snippet: Microsoft hopes the classroom version of the popular video game will help it achieve broader company objectives in education.
abstract: Microsoft announces acquisition of MinecraftEdu, modified version of game Minecraft that is meant for use in schools; company hopes acquisition will help it compete against other companies like Google and Apple, which have made inroads into classrooms, and effort will be test of whether Minecraft can help Microsoft achieve broader company objectives.

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and NATASHA SINGER
byline.contributor: Nick Wingfield reported from Seattle, and Natasha Singer from New York.

lead_paragraph: Microsoft hopes the classroom version of the popular video game will help it achieve broader company objectives in education.

headline.main: Microsoft Acquires Minecraft App for Schools
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Acquires Remix of Minecraft for Schools
